title: Saint Petersburg Theological Academy
text:
The Saint Petersburg Theological Academy () is a theological seminary in <a href="Saint%20Petersburg">Saint Petersburg</a>, <a href="Russia">Russia</a>. The academy grants master and doctorate degrees preparing theologians and priests for the <a href="Eastern%20Orthodox%20Church">Eastern Orthodox Church</a>. It was founded in 1797 by <a href="Gabriel%20%28Petrov%29">Gabriel (Petrov)</a>, Metropolitan of Saint Petersburg, as part of the <a href="Alexander%20Nevsky%20Lavra">Alexander Nevsky Lavra</a>.
At the turn of the 20th Century the Saint Petersburg Theological Academy was one of four religious academies of the Russian Orthodox Church. The class of 1898 had a total of 235 students regularly attending classes.
